summary: This bill, the Cerro de la Olla Wilderness Establishment Act, amends the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act to establish the Cerro de la Olla Wilderness within the Río Grande del Norte National Monument in New Mexico. It designates approximately 12,295 acres for wilderness protection, allows for the maintenance of existing wildlife water development projects, and modifies the boundary of the national monument. The bill also mandates a cooperative agreement between the Secretary and the State of New Mexico for wildlife management activities.
